refnamediv.refpurpose: Plots the specified UNIX plot_file in the MGED display.

refsection.para: Plots the specified UNIX plot_file in the MGED display. Phony object names are created for each part of the plot file that is in a unique color. The names are created by adding a color to the specified name, or to _PLOT_OVER if no name is provided. The color suffix is built by converting the RGB color to a six-digit hex number. Each color corresponds to 2 hex digits, so that white becomes "ffffff," red becomes "ff0000," green is "00ff00," etc.
The example shows the use of the overlay command to plot a specified UNIX plot file in the MGED display.

info.title: Plot a UNIX plot file in the MGED display.

example.para: Plots the UNIX plot file plot.upl in the MGED display, using tmp as the base for the phony object names.
